author: Jake Sarwar
title: Student Donates Bone Marrow to Save Life
text: WILKES-BARRE, LUZERNE CO. (WOLF) — The Health Resources & Services Administration estimates that nearly 18,000 people in the nation, ages 0-74, are diagnosed with life-threatening illnesses – in need of a bone marrow transplant. A donor looking for a potential match on the registry may forget they were on the list, like Delaney Hilferty. “I did not think I would be chosen at all it was amazing that I was. I was happy to help but it was a complete shock,” Hilferty says. Hilferty is a senior at King’s College in Wilkes-Barre, graduating in May with a degree in Business Management. Once finding out she was a match, she began the preliminary stages of donating bone marrow. “I answered a bunch of medical questions, and I did a full blood panel to double-check if I was a full match, which turned out I was, and we went on from there,” Hilferty explained. Undergoing the surgery three days ago, Hilferty is already back on campus. “It was a little slow, and we’re still a little slow right now, but we’re working our way up to walking normally again,” Hilferty said. Hilferty says the procedure is brief and manageable. “They go in the back of your pelvic bone in your lower back, and they insert two needles on both sides and dig around for about 45 minutes in the cartilage to take out what they need,” Hilferty says. Although her recipient is anonymous, Hilferty looks forward to meeting one day. “I can speak to him in a few years, I think. He has to reach out to me first before anything, but I would love to speak to him if he were to reach out,” Hilferty says. Hilferty is one of the women kickers on the football team! Head Coach Mike Cebrosky is ecstatic that his players want to give back to those in need. “For her to say she is willing to help somebody and save someone’s life, words can’t describe it. I am proud, she’s a great kid and will be a great leader one day of women just phenomenal,” Cebrosky said. Cebrosky says the team has been bringing awareness to the importance of stem cell research and donation for nearly a decade. “At 21 years old, she has done more in her life than most people have at 50 years old,” Cebrosky exclaimed.

author: /autor/Joseph/
title: ¡Desquite! Jasmine Camacho Quinn supera a las medallistas de oro y plata de París en la Liga Diamante - Primera Hora
text: ¡Desquite! Jasmine Camacho Quinn supera a las medallistas de oro y plata de París en la Liga Diamante La boricua cronometró 12.36 segundos para vencer a la estadounidense Masai Russell y la francesa Cyréna Samba-Mayela. PUBLICIDAD La vallista puertorriqueña Jasmine Camacho Quinn finalizó este jueves en la primera posición de los 100 metros con vallas con tiempo de 12.36 segundos en una parada de la Liga Diamante, que se celebró en Zúrich, Suiza. Con el triunfo, Camacho Quinn se desquitó de la medallista de oro de los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024, la estadounidense Masai Russell, quien culminó tercera al cronometrar 12.47 segundos. La francesa Cyréna Samba Mayela, que se alzó con la plata en la ciudad parisina, se adueñó esta vez del segundo del segundo puesto con tiempo de 12.40 segundos. La carrera marcó la primera ocasión que las tres medallistas olímpicas se reencuentran después de París 2024. Relacionadas Camacho Quinn estaba en duda para este evento debido a que estaba lidiando con dolencias en una de sus pantorrillas. Esta fue la segunda carrera de la vallista boricua desde que ganó la medalla de bronce en las Olimpiadas y su cuarta aparición en la Liga Diamante este año. Ahora la puertorriqueña apunta a conquistar la final de la Liga Diamante este 14 de septiembre en Bruselas, Bélgica. A pesar de que Camacho Quinn llegará a la carrera en la primera posición del clasificatorio, necesitará también ganar en Bruselas para asegurar el título. La boricua llegó a la prueba en Zúrich como la líder del escalafón de la Liga Diamante con 24 puntos, seguida por las jamaiquinas Ackera Nugent y Danielle Williams con 22 y 21 unidades cada una. Nugent no estuvo esta tarde en la pista, pero Williams dijo presente y terminó sexta con un cronómetro de 12.57 segundos.

author: DEMOS, Desarrollo de Medios, S.A. de C.V.
title: La Jornada: Celebra Palestina solicitud a La Haya para investigar el genocidio de Israel
text:
A nterior S iguiente Celebra Palestina solicitud a La Haya para investigar el genocidio de Israel Arturo Sánchez Jiménez Periódico La Jornada
Sábado 20 de enero de 2024, p. 5 Palestina dio ayer la bienvenida a la solicitud hecha por México y Chile para que la Corte Penal Internacional (CPI) investigue la posible comisión de genocidio y crímenes de lesa humanidad y de guerra en su territorio en el contexto de la guerra entre Israel y el grupo extremista Hamas.
El Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores palestino señaló ayer en un comunicado que la iniciativa de los gobiernos de Andrés Manuel López Obrador y Gabriel Boric confirma la urgente necesidad de que la Corte de La Haya cumpla su mandato de disuadir, investigar y enjuiciar los crímenes más graves que preocupan a la comunidad internacional .
Añadió que el Estado de Palestina se une a Chile y México para recordar al fiscal sus deberes de establecer la verdad, garantizar una investigación efectiva, perseguir las responsabilidades penales y emitir órdenes de detención .
Sostuvo que la CPI debe cumplir con su mandato hacia las víctimas palestinas y garantizar la justicia por los crímenes cometidos por funcionarios israelíes, sin temor ni favoritismo .
El gobierno palestino destacó que la acción de las dos naciones latinoamericanas se da dos meses después de que Sudáfrica acusó de genocidio a Israel ante la Corte Internacional de Justicia.
Saldos del conflicto
Desde entonces, Israel ha asesinado a más de 13 mil palestinos, incluyendo más de 5 mil niños, mientras al tiempo que consolidaba su uso de la inanición como método de guerra, ya que sus oficiales se sentían envalentonados para declarar públicamente su intención de destruir al pueblo palestino , según el ministerio del exterior palestino.
El jueves, y ante la escalada de violencia contra objetivos civiles, México y Chile pidieron a la CPI que investigue la probable comisión de genocidio y crímenes de guerra y de lesa humanidad en Palestina.
Ambos gobiernos remitieron la situación palestina al fiscal de la Corte y señalaron que han visto con preocupación creciente la posible comisión de crímenes en el contexto del conflicto en Gaza.
A nterior S iguiente Subir al inicio del texto Please enable JavaScript to view the comments powered by Disqus.

author: Kendall Tietz
title: Massachusetts considers trust funds for state's poorest newborns to help 'shrink the racial wealth gap'
text: Massachusetts is considering trust funds, aimed at reducing the racial wealth gap, for the state's poorest newborns that the recipients would be able to access when they turn 18. The "baby bonds" would be an at-birth publicly funded trust fund program for Massachusetts residents , to be used for college, buying a home or starting a business. The amount given to each eligible newborn would depend on their household income, although it doesn't give a maximum amount or specify who would qualify for the funds. "Children born into households with low income (which are disproportionately households of color) are prioritized through eligibility requirements set by the state or through a progressive allocation system, with those with the lowest income receiving the largest investments," the Massachusetts state government says on its website. "This is to provide the most support to children born with the least resources, and to shrink the racial wealth gap." VA GOV. YOUNGKIN SAYS BUDGET PROPOSAL PRIORITIZES EARLY LEARNING AND CHILD CARE PROGRAMS Newborn babies in a hospital nursery. (ER Productions Limited via Getty Images) The trust funds aim to narrow the racial wealth gap in Massachusetts, as well as increase "access to financial education, closing the race and gender wage gap, addressing racial equity, expanding college affordability , and promoting STEM education."The program could cost the state roughly $52 million annually with an estimated 8,000 infants qualifying each year in Massachusetts, The Boston Globe reported . In March 2022, the State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg announced at the Economic Empowerment Trust Fund board meeting that she was convening a task force to explore the creation of Baby Bonds in Massachusetts. Goldberg told The Globe that officials have not yet identified a funding source for the program, but that it will "hopefully… be a priority" that "will receive the kind of funding it needs."Democratic state Sen. Paul R. Feeley, who introduced the bill in Massachusetts, said the trust funds would "build wealth from the bottom up," putting poorer people "on a trajectory for real opportunity from day one," The Daily Mail reported . WISCONSIN GOV. EVERS FINDS $170M IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO CONTINUE COVID-ERA CHILDCARE SUBSIDIES "By investing at the start of a child's life, we are providing a jump-start to individuals otherwise at a disadvantage by beginning to narrow the racial wealth gap and giving our most vulnerable residents a fighting shot at the middle class and the American Dream," Feeley said. A national version of the law is currently stalled in Congress. (iStock) A national version of the law, the American Opportunity Accounts Act, which has stalled in Congress, proposes giving each child a $1,000 seed deposit at birth, followed by annual deposits of up to $2,000 based on their parents' income. Children from the lowest-income families could accrue $46,215 by the time they turn 18, while qualifying families in the highest income bracket could accrue around $1,681, according to the Daily Mail. THREE MILLION CHILDREN SET TO LOSE CHILD CARE WITH EXPIRATION OF FEDERAL FUNDING In Connecticut, which has its own infant trust fund, low-income babies are given a one-time deposit of $3,200, which is held in the bonds and accrues interest until they are 18, according to Massachusetts Baby Bonds task force findings . In Washington, D.C., any child born in the district on or after October 1, 2021, to a family enrolled in Medicaid with an income of 300% of the Federal Poverty Line, is eligible to receive an initial deposit of at least $500. Similarly, California approved a trust fund of up to $8,000 each for children who lost a parent or guardian to COVID-19. Baby bond proposals are also under consideration in Iowa, New Jersey, New York, and Wisconsin. CLICK TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP

author: Shaila Rosagel
title: Sequía seguirá en Sonora con ‘La Niña’; prevén menos agua
text: Sequía seguirá en Sonora con ‘La Niña’; prevén menos agua Este fenómeno, que se espera en septiembre, perjudicará a la entidad. CIUDAD DE MÉXICO.- La sequía y falta de lluvias continuarán en Sonora al menos hasta junio, cuando el monzón brinde un poco de humedad, pero regresará con la entrada del [ fenómeno “La Niña”](https://www.elimparcial.com/mundo/2021/10/18/la-nina-esta-de-regreso-que-es-y-que-significa-para-el-clima-en-america-latina/) en septiembre, el cual no beneficiará a la entidad, sino la perjudicará con menos agua. Reynaldo Pascual Ramírez, jefe de Proyectos de Pronóstico Estacional del Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN), dijo en entrevista con Grupo Healy que hay un 74% de probabilidad que entre a México el fenómeno de “La Niña” en los meses de septiembre, octubre y noviembre y que tendrá su pico máximo en el invierno 2024-2025. Pero para la zona Norte del País no les trae demasiada humedad, sino menos humedad de la esperada”, dijo. En Sonora hay una declaración de emergencia por la sequía desde el 22 de febrero y [presas, como la Abelardo L. Rodríguez, lucen secas y desoladas al cero por ciento de su capacidad.](https://www.elimparcial.com/videos/2024/03/22/la-presa-de-hermosillo-luce-desolada-emergencia-hidrica-en-mexico/) De acuerdo con la Coordinación Estatal de Protección Civil hay emergencia hídrica en 69 de los 72 municipios de Sonora, pues según el Monitor de Sequía hay 24 municipios en sequía excepcional y 37 extrema. Hermosillo, Cajeme, Guaymas, Navojoa, Empalme, Etchojoa, Mazatán, Sahuaripa, San Pedro de la Cueva, Yécora, Tepache y Villa Hidalgo se encuentran con sequía excepcional. EXPECTATIVA Prevén se registre este año el fenómeno “La Niña”. 74% DE PROBABILIDAD QUE ENTRE A MÉXICO “LA NIÑA”. - Septiembre, octubre y noviembre serían los meses en que se presentaría. - Tendrá su pico máximo en el invierno 2024-2025. EN 69 DE LOS 72 MUNICIPIOS DE SONORA HAY EMERGENCIA HÍDRICA. Fuente: SMN y CEPC.

author: sina.com.cn
title: 港股回购活跃，今年以来总金额突破500亿港元|港股_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
近期，港股上市公司回购活动升温。根据Wind统计，截至4月16日记者发稿时，4月以来，112家港股上市公司实施了回购，累计回购金额为89.67亿港元。与上月同期相比，4月以来实施回购的上市公司数量和总金额分别增长286.21%、171.15%。2025年以来，港股上市公司回购总金额已突破500亿港元。
整体来看，积极实施回购的公司不仅集中在金融蓝筹和互联网科技板块，部分消费企业也加大了回购力度。机构人士称，在港股市场近期出现明显波动后，港股回购活动明显升温，这传递了乐观情绪，有助于提升市场信心。（中国证券报）
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->market and exchange
Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance

author: Vahur Lauri | ERR
title: Expert on Ukraine aid reduction: Russia will fight to the end
text:
Democratic Congressman Joe Morelle of New York asked Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth whether the U.S. government plans to request funding for military aid to Ukraine next year. The secretary responded that the budget would be cut.
"There will be a reduced budget. As you know, the current administration takes a very different approach to this conflict. We believe that a peace achieved through negotiations is in the interest of both parties and our own country," Hegseth said.
But what exactly constitutes a peaceful solution for both sides and the U.S. government? The Trump administration has yet to define that.
Chair of the Riigikogu National Defense Committee Kalev Stoicescu (Eesti 200) said that Russia is trying to show everyone — including Ukraine — that it will fight to the end. "And it won't settle for anything less than victory — that is, the capitulation of Ukraine and, in essence, the West," Stoicescu said.
Maj. Gen. (ret.) Meelis Kiili, also a member of the National Defense Committee, said that Ukrainians are backed into a corner. "For them, it's a matter of survival. For Russia, it's a matter of the regime's survival," Kiili said.
An existing mineral resources agreement between Ukraine and the U.S. allows Americans to sell military equipment to Ukraine if they choose to do so. At this point, however, it remains unclear whether this so-called peace would mean survival for the Ukrainian people, the survival of Putin's regime or something else entirely.
--
Follow ERR News on Facebook , Bluesky and X and never miss an update!
Editor: Marcus Turovski, Aleksander Krjukov
kalev stoicescu ukraine aid pete hegseth ukraine peace process russo-ukrainian war

author: DEONISIA ARLINTA
title: Sperm Selection Technology Increases Pregnancy Success - Kompas.id
text: [›](/) [English](/kategori/english)›Sperm Selection Technology... Sperm Selection Technology Increases Pregnancy Success Assisted reproductive technology has been shown to increase the chances of overcoming infertility About AI Translated Article Please note that this article was automatically translated using Microsoft Azure AI, Open AI, and Google Translation AI. We cannot ensure that the entire content is translated accurately. If you spot any errors or inconsistencies, contact us at [hotline@kompas.id](mailto:hotline@kompas.id), and we'll make every effort to address them. Thank you for your understanding. The following article was translated using both Microsoft Azure Open AI and Google Translation AI. The original article can be found in [Teknologi Seleksi Sperma Tingkatkan Keberhasilan Kehamilan](https://www.kompas.id/baca/humaniora/2024/01/07/teknologi-seleksi-sperma-tingkatkan-keberhasilan-kehamilan) Modification of sperm quality selection methods in assisted reproductive technology can increase the success rate of various pregnancy programs. This is in accordance with the results of research conducted by a professor at the Faculty of Medicine, University of Indonesia. Reproductive system disorders can lead to infertility. This condition occurs when a husband and wife are unable to conceive a child after approximately one year of regular, unprotected sex. The World Health Organization (WHO) stated that at least one out of six couples of productive age experience infertility. This number is equivalent to approximately 186 million people worldwide. The prevalence of infertility for couples of productive age, between 25-44 years old, is about 9 percent. In Indonesia, data from the National Development Planning Agency (Bappenas) in 2018 showed that the incidence of infertility in couples of reproductive age reached 10-15 percent or 4-6 million couples. Around 40-70 percent of infertility is caused by male factors. However, awareness of male infertility in society is still low, due to limited access and stigma. Male infertility is primarily caused by a decrease in sperm concentration, poor sperm motility (quality of sperm movement), and abnormal sperm morphology. Various efforts have been developed to address male infertility, including Assisted Reproductive Technology (ART). Assisted reproductive technologies, such as intrauterine insemination and in vitro fertilization have been shown to increase the chances of overcoming infertility related to sperm quality. However, the success of assisted reproductive technologies varies widely. One of the factors that determines the success rate of TRB is sperm selection or sperm preparation. This was conveyed by Professor of Medical Biology at the Faculty of Medicine, University of Indonesia, Silvia Werdhy Lestari, during her inauguration speech in Jakarta on Wednesday, November 8th, 2023. The title of her scientific speech is "Sperm Selection Innovation in Assisted Reproductive Technology: The Importance of Men's Reproductive Health in Creating a Healthy Human Resource, Towards Indonesia Emas 2045". Silvia is the 66th Professor of the University of Indonesia appointed in 2023. Also Read: [Seahorse Extract for Male Fertility](https://www.kompas.id/baca/humaniora/2023/10/19/ekstrak-kuda-laut-untuk-kesuburan-pria) Silvia said that sperm selection can be done using the swim up technique, density gradient centrifugation (DGC), or a combination. This technique is carried out at various speeds and periods in centrifugation (mixture separation). However, the sperm selection procedure can sometimes damage the sperm itself due to repeated centrifugation and pipetting processes. As a result, the end result of the sperm selection method becomes less than expected. Assisted reproductive technology performed also fails as a result. "That is why there needs to be innovation or discovery of new research applications in the form of modified sperm selection on TRB and improvements in sperm quality before the TRB method is performed," said Silvia. Modification of sperm selection Silvia expressed that research conducted together with her team has proven that modification of the technique for sperm selection or preparation can increase the success rate of patient pregnancy. The modification of the method for selecting sperm quality is carried out by considering the combination of motile sperm (active sperm) count and sperm DNA fragmentation index (IFD). The success of assisted reproductive technology varies greatly. One factor that determines the success rate of ART is sperm selection or sperm preparation. Silvia's research was conducted by modifying the technique in the DGC method that is tailored to the quality of the sperm sample. Through this method, the process of sperm selection will not excessively damage the quality of the sperm, especially in the conditions of abnormal or even damaged sperm. "The modified technique of sperm preparation in our effort to select sperm has proven to increase the success rate and pregnancy success in our patients undergoing intrauterine insemination (IUI) at our infertility center. We have also taken care of copyrights for this modified technique of sperm preparation," said Silvia. He added that his other research also proved that, apart from the quality parameter of sperm, there is an additional parameter that can help screen the quality of sperm before the TRB method is performed. Another parameter that must also be considered is the sperm DNA fragmentation index. In addition, the provision of other substrates, such as ALA (alpha-lipoic acid) as an antioxidant and PRL (prolactin) as a free radical scavenger, has a good effect on sperm. The provision of these substrates can also improve the quality of sperm from preparation results. ALA and PRL substrates can protect sperm from the harmful effects of the sperm preparation process. Type of pregnancy program Silvia and her team also carried out other research related to modified sperm selection based on the type of pregnancy program (promil). The pregnancy program can be adjusted by combining the condition of the number of motile sperm with the sperm DNA fragmentation index (IFD). If the number of motile sperm is more than 40 million and IFD is less than 15%, promil can be done with natural conception through regular sexual intercourse between husband and wife. Also Read: [Diet Affects Sperm Quality Quickly](https://www.kompas.id/baca/ilmu-pengetahuan-teknologi/2020/01/06/diet-memengaruhi-mutu-sperma-dengan-cepat) Meanwhile, if the number of motile sperm is more than 40 million and the IFD is 15-30 percent, you can carry out promil with intrauterine insemination (IIU). In sperm conditions with a motile sperm count of more than 40 million and an IFD of more than 30 percent, promil can be carried out with in vitro fertilization (FIV), intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI), or test-tube baby. For conditions where sperm count is between 5-40 million and the percentage of motile sperm is 15-30%, Promol IIU can be performed. However, if the amount of motile sperm is between 5-40 million and the percentage of IFD is greater than 30%, Promil can be carried out using FIV, ICSI, or test tube baby methods. In cases where sperm count is less than 5 million and the percentage of IFD is greater than 30%, Promil can be achieved through FIV, ICSI, or test tube baby methods. "Modifying the method of selecting sperm quality by combining the number of motile sperm and sperm DNA fragmentation can produce optimal sperm conditions for use in various types of pregnancy programs, including natural conception, IUI, IVF, ICSI, and test tube babies. It is hoped that through this modification, the success of pregnancy in these programs can be increased," said Silvia. The research will continue to be conducted with a focus on men's reproductive health. Subsequent research can be carried out by modifying sperm selection at the cellular or molecular level, or by studying ways to improve embryo quality from the perspective of sperm and the development of sperm stem cells. Also Read: [Modern Life and Climate Change Reduce Male Sperm Quality](https://www.kompas.id/baca/humaniora/2023/05/23/kehidupan-modern-dan-perubahan-iklim-turunkan-kualitas-sperma-laki-laki) Separately, a specialist obstetrician and gynecologist at Harapan Kita Mother and Child Hospital (RSAB), Gde Suardana, on the official website of RSAB Harapan Kita, conveyed that infertility is now more commonly found in large cities due to poor lifestyle habits. The lifestyle in urban areas tends to cause stress and lead to unbalanced eating habits. Assisted reproductive programs are a way to overcome infertility in married couples. "The earlier couples with infertility issues undergo examination and assisted reproductive programs, the greater the chance of successfully getting pregnant," he said.

author: Victor Correia
title: Brasil será autossuficiente em remédio contra hemofilia, diz Nísia Trindade
text: A ministra da Saúde, Nísia Trindade , afirmou nesta quinta-feira (4/4) que a nova fábrica da Hemobrás inaugurada em Goiana, Pernambuco, será capaz de produzir 1,2 bilhão de unidades do medicamento Hemo-8r, contra a hemofilia. A quantidade atenderá a toda a demanda brasileira. Nísia participou da inauguração da planta em Goiana, Pernambuco, ao lado do presidente Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva . Ela destacou também que apenas cinco países possuem a tecnologia para produzir o remédio. Pernambuco terá 1ª fábrica de medicamentos para o SUS do Brasil Nísia: "Estamos trabalhando para que o sangue não seja uma mercadoria" Hemobrás deve começar a funcionar só dez anos depois de sua criação "Essa planta que inauguramos hoje vai produzir 1,2 bilhão de unidades e poder atender, dessa maneira, de forma contínua, aos que precisam desse medicamento. E quem sabe, no futuro, a gente possa apoiar outros países", discursou a ministra durante a cerimônia de inauguração. Segundo a pasta, a planta deve atender a 100% da demanda do Sistema Único de Saúde (SUS) pelo medicamento. O Hemo-8r é usado para prevenir sangramentos espontâneos em pessoas com a hemofilia A, que corresponde a cerca de 80% dos casos da doença. Cerca de 15 mil brasileiros convivem com a hemofilia. Apenas cinco países têm a tecnologia O remédio já é fornecido pela Hemobrás para o SUS, por meio de uma parceria com empresas estrangeiras. A fábrica deve entrar em operação plena a partir do ano que vem. O Ministério da Saúde espera que a produção nacional derrube em 30% o preço do Hemo-8r repassado ao sistema único. Segundo Nísia, apenas cinco países atualmente possuem a tecnologia para produzir o medicamento. Ela afirmou ainda que o Complexo da Hemobrás deve inaugurar uma outra planta ainda este ano, para a produção de imunoderivados , como imunoglobulina e albumina. Também participaram da inauguração a primeira-dama Rosângela da Silva, a Janja, os ministros Luciana Santos (Ciência e Tecnologia), Silvio Costa Filho (Portos e Aeroportos) e Antônio Padilha (Secretaria de Relações Institucionais), bem como a governadora de Pernambuco, Raquel Lyra. O Correio tem um espaço na edição impressa para publicar a opinião dos leitores pelo e-mail [sredat.df@dabr.com.br](mailto:sredat.df@dabr.com.br)
